developer.name: Andreas Ink
developer.bio: I build cool and impactful apps that help people be healthier and/or productive.
developer.work: I work part time as an iOS developer at Rune Labs, study at the University of North FL, and explore side projects on the weekends

content.name: Andreas Ink
content.bio:
About the developer...

I build cool and impactful apps that help people be healthier and/or productive.

content.content: I work part time as an iOS developer at Rune Labs, study at the University of North FL, and explore side projects on the weekends

default: Covid Watch's mission was to reduce the spread of Covid-19 with Exposure Notifications.
Exposure Notifications encouraged people to take precautions if they were exposed to Covid-19, such as isolate or wear a mask.
I learned how to work on a team, code in SwiftUI, and importantly, understand that anything is possible with a lot of effort and a bit of luck.
resumeMode: Implemented UI improvements with UIKit and SwiftUI
Contributed to a 12% reduction in Covid-19 transmission at The University of Arizona in 2020
Achieved 23rd place in the App Store for medical apps
Developed app and marketing materials featured on National ABC News
Supported Google and Apple's Exposure Notification framework integration

default: I founded Vito with similar principals to Covid Watch.
However, I took a more aggressive approach with privacy and public perception because A) it's the right thing to do and B) it would lead to greater adoption.

My theory was that while Covid Watch was effective, it lacked solid adoption, with stricter privacy and community involvement + less dependence on adoption, I thought Vito would have a greater impact by estimating Covid-19 onset with vitals.
While eventually I had to abandon the project, I'm proud of the community and app we built.  I learned a lot about research, community building, among other things.
resumeMode: Founded Vito, an open-source research project focused on early detection of infectious diseases using vitals
Implemented algorithmic techniques on iOS, Android, and Streamlit with Swift, Kotlin, and Python
Grew a community of 50 student collaborators over the course of a year

default: I founded Cerebellia to help people like my Dad make lifestyle changes to improve their health in context of Parkinson's Disease.
My partner and I built a prototype PCB that interfaced with an iOS app and movement disorder kit by Apple.
Eventually Cerebellia ended up in Tech Crunch and The Verge from a cold email which was amazing!
I learned how to develop hardware, how to market to news sites, and most importantly it felt great to help my Dad with his disease.
resumeMode: Featured in TechCrunch and The Verge for innovations in health tech
Obtained special entitlement to use Apple's Movement Disorder API for tremor measurement with Apple Watch
Developed a native iOS app promoting lifestyle adjustments for individuals with Parkinson's Disease

default: After the news feature of Cerebellia, Rune Labs noticed it and offered me a job!
I was very excited to join as my partner for Cerebellia decided to pivot before the news feature and as I've seen, a team is core to impact.
At Rune, it felt amazing to work with great teammates and code a feature in my room upstairs, then go downstairs and test with my Dad and get his feedback :)
resumeMode: Increased App Store ratings by 0.6 stars with activity, insight, and in app rating features for StrivePD
Modernized codebase using Swift Package Manager and SwiftUI
Developed Siri integration for enhanced app interactions

rune: Developed a tremor and dyskinesia chart
Refreshed the entire app's UI with SwiftUI and UIKit
Implemented tap test used by pharma partner
pingPath: Launched a SwiftUI app that helps visually impaired people interact with the world
Conducted user research to improve UX
Implemented a pathfinding algorithm and utilized spatial audio to help guide blind people in spaces
examCram: Built a SwiftUI app that works on almost any Apple platform
Developed React web app for greater access to the service

secondaryText: Thank you for trying the app
I've spent countless hours working to improve my apps and make an impact.
One reason I do this is to hear thank you's more often, so if you find this app helpful, feel free to leave a review :)
